Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheMsaaState
Values.Description: PAL MSAA state objects (all graphics pipelines)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheColorBlendState
Values.Description: PAL color blend state objects (all graphics pipelines)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheDepthStencilState
Values.Description: PAL depth stencil state objects (all graphics pipelines)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheInputAssemblyState
Values.Description: PAL input assembly state params (all graphics pipelines)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheTriangleRasterState
Values.Description: Triangle raster state params (part of every graphics pipeline)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticPointLineRasterState
Values.Description: Point line raster state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticDepthBias
Values.Description: Depth bias state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticBlendConst
Values.Description: Blend const state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticDepthBounds
Values.Description: Depth bounds state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticScissorRect
Values.Description: Scissor rect state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticSamplePattern
Values.Description: Sample patern state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticGraphicsWaveLimits
Values.Description: Graphics wave limits state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticComputeWaveLimits
Values.Description: Compute wave limits state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticAnisoLodCompensation
Values.Description: Aniso LOD compensation state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticLineStipple
Values.Description: Line stipple state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: DevModeSqttMarkerEnableCbStart
Values.Description: Enable command buffer start instrumentation marker

Values.Name: DevModeSqttMarkerEnableCbEnd
Values.Description: Enable command buffer end instrumentation marker

Values.Name: DevModeSqttMarkerEnableGeneralApi
Values.Description: Enable general API (per entry point call) instrunmentation markers

Values.Name: DevModeSqttMarkerEnableEventWithDims
Values.Description: Enable dispatch events with thread dimensions

Settings.Name: RenderPassLogEnable
Settings.Description: Write a graph visualization of each created render pass in .dot format

Settings.Name: RenderPassLogDirectory
Settings.Description: Relative directory where render pass graphs are placed. Root directory is determined in device. Each unique render pass is in a separate file within that directory. The log name is based on a hash of the render pass's create info.

Settings.Name: RenderPassLogFlags
Settings.Description: A bitmask of flags that control what kind of information is written to the render pass log.

Values.Description: Include waits and signal event info.

Settings.Description: Use shared CmdAllocator for all command buffers.
Settings.Name: UseSharedCmdAllocator

Values.Name: GpuHeapInvisible
Values.Description: This is invalid! Allocations must be mappable

Settings.Description: The primary heap for the internal CmdAllocator for command data.
Settings.Name: CmdAllocatorDataHeap

Settings.Description: Size of allocation chunks used by CmdAllocators for command data.
Settings.Name: CmdAllocatorDataAllocSize

Settings.Description: Size of suballocations used by CmdAllocators for command data.
Settings.Name: CmdAllocatorDataSubAllocSize

Values.Name: GpuHeapInvisible
Values.Description: This is invalid! Allocations must be mappable

Settings.Description: The primary heap for the internal CmdAllocator for embedded data.
Settings.Name: CmdAllocatorEmbeddedHeap
CmdAllocatorEmbeddedAllocSize
Settings.Description: Size of allocation chunks used by CmdAllocators for embedded data

Settings.Name: CmdAllocatorEmbeddedSubAllocSize
Settings.Description: Size of suballocations used by CmdAllocators for embedded data

Settings.Name: CmdAllocatorScratchHeap
Settings.Description: The primary heap for the internal CmdAllocator for GPU scratch memory. Note: this field is ignored by PAL and will always be GpuHeapInvisible.

Settings.Name: CmdAllocatorScratchAllocSize
Settings.Description: Size of allocation chunks used by CmdAllocators for GPU scratch memory.

Settings.Name: CmdAllocatorScratchSubAllocSize
Settings.Description: Size of suballocations used by CmdAllocators for GPU scratch memory.

Settings.Name: PrefetchCommands
Settings.Description: Prefetch command buffers to L2 using CPDMA

Settings.Name: PadVertexBuffers
Settings.Description: Pad vertex buffers if the range isn't the multiple of stride.

Settings.Name: DisableResetReleaseResources
Settings.Description: Disable resources releasing when resetting command buffer.

Settings.Name: CacheUuidNamespace
Settings.Description: Defines the namespace the pipeline cache UUID belongs to.

Values.Name: CacheUuidNamespaceDefault
Values.Description: Use the default namespace for the platform.

Values.Name: CacheUuidNamespaceGlobal
Values.Description: Force usage of a global (portable) scope.

Values.Name: CacheUuidNamespaceLocal
Values.Description: Force usage of a local (non-portable) scope.

Settings.Name: MarkPipelineCacheWithBuildTimestamp
Settings.Description: Controls whether the pipeline cache is tagged with the build timestamp.
Controls which category messages are output to log file (/var/tmp/palLog.txt). e.g. enable PipelineCompileTime(enum LogTagId in icd/api/include/log.h), logTagIdMask |= 1<<PipelineCompileTime
Settings.Name: LogTagIdMask
PipelineFastCompileMode
Settings.Description: Controls how SC 'fast compile mode' (disable optimizations) is enabled

Values.Name: PipelineFastCompileApiControlled
Values.Description: 'Fast compile' disabled (SC fast optimizations enabled) if VK_PIPELINE_CREATE_DISABLE_OPTIMIZATION_BIT is set.

Values.Name: PipelineFastCompileNeverOptimized
Values.Description: 'Fast compile' always enabled (disables SC shader optimization).

Values.Name: PipelineFastCompileAlwaysOptimized
Values.Description: 'Fast compile' always disabled (SC fast optimizations enabled).

Settings.Name: PipelineBinningMode
Settings.Description: Specifies whether to override binning setting for pipeline.

Settings.Name: PipelineUseProfileHashAsClientHash
Settings.Description: If true, the profile hash (calculated exclusively from SPIRV + entry point) is used as PAL client hash and will appear in e.g. GPUProfiler layer measurements.  Useful when writing and updating pipeline profiles for applications.

Settings.Name: PipelineUseShaderHashAsProfileHash
Settings.Description: If true, the shader hash (calcualte from SPIRV) is used as profile hash.

Settings.Name: EnablePipelineProfileDumping
Settings.Description: Enable dumping of tuning optimizations in JSON format, as applied to shaders for a currently runnning app
File (in relative path) to dump app shader profile to. Root directory is determined by AMD_DEBUG_DIR environment variable
Settings.Name: PipelineProfileDumpFile
PipelineProfileRuntimeFile
Settings.Description: Relative Path to a JSON file that describes a shader app profile that is parsed at runtime. This setting only triggers on debug builds or builds made with the ICD_RUNTIME_APP_PROFILE=1 option. This file has the same format as the JSON files used to build production shader app profiles. Root directory is determined by AMD_DEBUG_DIR environment variable

Settings.Name: PipelineProfileDbgPrintProfileMatch
Settings.Description: Prints a message to the debugger when a pipeline profile matches a pipeline. Only valid on debug builds or builds built with PAL_ENABLE_PRINTS_ASSERTS=1.

Settings.Name: PipelineProfileIgnoresAppProfile
Settings.Description: If this is true, any production app profile-installed shader optimizations are ignored.

Settings.Name: PipelineProfileHaltOnParseFailure
Settings.Description: If the driver fails to parse a runtime profile JSON file, it will assert and enter into an infinite loop if this setting is TRUE.

Settings.Name: DisableEmbedConstArrays
Settings.Description: If indexable constant arrays end up as local variables instead of literals, this embeds them  into the shader code so they can be indexed instead of spilling to memory and reading back.

Settings.Name: ForceDepthClampBasedOnZExport
Settings.Description: This setting can be used to force depth clamping to be based on Z_EXPORT_ENABLE. It directly affects DISABLE_VIEWPORT_CLAMP bit in h/w register. It should be set only for applications that have perf drops with normal depth clamping beahvior

Settings.Name: UmdFramePacerControl
Settings.Description: Enable UMD frame pacer control.

Settings.Name: EnableFRTC
Settings.Description: Enable Frame Rate Target Control.

Settings.Name: EnableTurboSync
Settings.Description: Enable Turbo Sync control.

Settings.Name: FullscreenFrameMetadataSupport
Settings.Description: Support Fullscreen Frame Metadata.

Settings.Name: UseSdmaCompositingBlt
Settings.Description: For software compositing, perform an SDMA blt on the slave device instead of using its present queue.

Settings.Name: EnableMailboxPresentMode
Settings.Description: Enable VK_PRESENT_MODE_MAILBOX_KHR present mode support on Windows OS.

Settings.Name: EnableAcquireBeforeSignal
Settings.Description: Allows acquiring of swap chain images while present is still active

Settings.Name: IgnoreSuboptimalSwapchainSize
Settings.Description: When true, no check is done to see if the swapchain surface size has changed since creation.

Settings.Name: DelayFullScreenAcquireToFirstPresent
Settings.Description: When true, delays acquiring exclusive full screen to the first present. May be needed in cases where the OS state gets messed up because of early acquires by the application

Settings.Name: SyncOsHdrState
Settings.Description: When true, create a dummy FP16 swapchain to sync the OS HDR state and avoid dim desktop issues during Alt+Tab and app exit from HDR modes

Settings.Name: ForceMinImageCount
Settings.Description: A non-zero value will force to set the minimum count of swap chain images

Settings.Name: EnableRelocatableShaders
Settings.Description: Builds a pipeline by linking reloctable shader elf, which have been built individually.  Only valid when LLPC is the pipeline compiler.
Enable pipeline dump, pipeline is stored with .pipe format. You must set AMD_DEBUG_DIR and make sure $AMD_DEBUG_DIR + pipelineDumpDir is  an available directory.
Settings.Name: EnablePipelineDump

Settings.Description: Relative directory where pipeline info is dumped. Root directory is determined by AMD_DEBUG_DIR environment variable. Each unique pipeline is in a separate file within that directory. The log name is based on a hash of the pipeline's create info and  which shader stages are active.
Settings.Name: PipelineDumpDir

Values.Description: Enable output both general info and error message.

Settings.Description: Enable log general output and error message in LLPC and BIL.
Settings.Name: EnableLog

Settings.Description: Filename of the log file in LLPC and BIL. Directory of the log file is PipelineDumpDir. Note that logFileName does not includes <path> and <.txt>. Full path of log file is: PipelineDumpDir+LogFileNameBil.txt or PipelineDumpDir+LogFileNameLlpc.txt.
Settings.Name: LogFileName

Settings.Description: Enable output diagnostic info. This info may added to AMD IL or external debug log files.
Settings.Name: EnableDebug

Settings.Description: Filename of the file to log debug information.  If the file name is empty, the message will be output to stderr.
Settings.Name: DebugLogFileName

Values.Name: ShaderReplaceShaderHash
Values.Description: Enable shader hash based shader replacement, for any shader whose hash is AAA, if there is a file named shader_0xAAA_replace.spv under ShaderReplacementDir, this file will be used to replace the original shader.

Values.Name: ShaderReplaceShaderPipelineHash
Values.Description: Enable shader hash plus pipeline hash filter based shader replacement, shader hash based shader replacement will only be enabled for pipelines whose hash is in ShaderReplacementPipelineHashs.

Values.Name: ShaderReplacePipelineBinaryHash
Values.Description: Enable pipeline binary hash based pipeline binary replacement, for any pipeline binary whose hash is AAA, if there is a file named PipelneXXX_0xAAA_replace.elf under ShaderReplacementDir, this file will be used to replace the original pipeline binary.

Values.Name: ShaderReplaceShaderISA
Values.Description: Enable replace ISA shader in the pipeline, For every pipeline in the ShaderReplacementPipelineHashs, would find if there is a file named 0xAAA_replace.txt under ShaderReplacementDir, would be loaded for the replacement the replace shader look like this  *----offset: ISACODE----* 848:0x7E120303   1480:0x7E1E0303  2592:0x7E0E030E

Settings.Description: Enable shader replacement. This option is valid only if LLPC path is enabled.
Settings.Name: ShaderReplaceMode

Settings.Description: Relative directory where shader replacement files are stored. Root directory is determined in device.
Settings.Name: ShaderReplaceDir

Settings.Description: Only valid if shaderReplaceMode is set to 2 and 4. This is a comma separated pipeline hash list. Hash number is in big case, example hash list looks like: 0xAD033E031BF7CB6C,0x1B707F37B7DA34E3
Settings.Name: ShaderReplacePipelineHashes

Settings.Description: Drop specified instruction in pipeline binary for quick debugging shader. It replaces all matching instruction opcodes with NOPs and needs to work with DropPipelineBinaryInstToken and DropPipelineBinaryInstSize together.
Settings.Name: EnableDropPipelineBinaryInst

Settings.Description: Change the API-exposed subgroupSize 0  - The maximum supported waveSize of the GPU (default) 32 - Subgroup size of 32 64 - Subgroup size of 64
Settings.Name: SubgroupSize

Settings.Description: Force vertex shaders to run with a particular wave size. This is ignored if subgroup operations are used by the shader, see SubgroupSize. 0  - Let compiler choose Wave32 vs Wave64 mode (default) 32 - Run in Wave32 mode 64 - Run in Wave64 mode
Settings.Name: VsWaveSize

Settings.Description: Force tessellation control shaders to run with a particular wave size. This is ignored if subgroup operations are used by the shader, see SubgroupSize. 0  - Let compiler choose Wave32 vs Wave64 mode (default) 32 - Run in Wave32 mode 64 - Run in Wave64 mode
Settings.Name: TcsWaveSize

Settings.Description: Force tessellation evaluation shaders to run with a particular wave size. This is ignored if subgroup operations are used by the shader, see SubgroupSize. 0  - Let compiler choose Wave32 vs Wave64 mode (default) 32 - Run in Wave32 mode 64 - Run in Wave64 mode
Settings.Name: TesWaveSize

Settings.Description: Force geometry shaders to run with a particular wave size. This is ignored if subgroup operations are used by the shader, see SubgroupSize. 0  - Let compiler choose Wave32 vs Wave64 mode (default) 32 - Run in Wave32 mode 64 - Run in Wave64 mode
Settings.Name: GsWaveSize

Settings.Description: Force fragment shaders to run with a particular wave size. This is ignored if subgroup operations are used by the shader, see SubgroupSize. 0  - Let compiler choose Wave32 vs Wave64 mode (default) 32 - Run in Wave32 mode 64 - Run in Wave64 mode
Settings.Name: FsWaveSize

Settings.Description: Force compute shaders to run with a particular wave size. This is ignored if subgroup operations are used by the shader, see SubgroupSize. 0  - Let compiler choose Wave32 vs Wave64 mode (default) 32 - Run in Wave32 mode 64 - Run in Wave64 mode
Settings.Name: CsWaveSize

Settings.Description: Force ray tracing shaders to run with a particular wave size. This is ignored if subgroup operations are used by the shader, see SubgroupSize. 0  - Let compiler choose Wave32 vs Wave64 mode (default) 32 - Run in Wave32 mode 64 - Run in Wave64 mode
Settings.Name: RtWaveSize

Settings.Description: Enable NGG mode, use an implicit primitive shader on a per-pipeline type basis. Use this instead of PAL setting, NggEnableMode.
Settings.Name: EnableNgg

Settings.Description: [LLPC ONLY] Force NGG to run in culling mode.
Settings.Name: NggForceCullingMode

Settings.Description: Compaction mode after culling operations. 0 - Compaction is disabled 1 - Compaction is based on vertices
Settings.Name: NggCompactionMode

Settings.Description: [LLPC ONLY] Always use primitive shader table to fetch culling-control registers.
Settings.Name: NggAlwaysUsePrimShaderTable

Settings.Description: Control NGG backface culling algorithm (1 ~ UINT32_MAX, 0 disables it).
Settings.Name: NggBackfaceExponent

Values.Name: NggSubgroupAuto
Values.Description: Sub-group size is allocated as optimally determined

Values.Name: NggSubgroupMaximumSize
Values.Description: Sub-group size is allocated to the maximum allowable size by the hardware

Values.Name: NggSubgroupHalfSize
Values.Description: Sub-group size is allocated as to allow half of the maximum allowable size by the hardware

Values.Name: NggSubgroupOptimizeForVerts
Values.Description: Sub-group size is optimized for vertex thread utilization

Values.Name: NggSubgroupOptimizeForPrims
Values.Description: Sub-group size is optimized for primitive thread utilization

Values.Name: NggSubgroupExplicit
Values.Description: Sub-group size is allocated based on explicitly-specified vertsPerSubgroup and primsPerSubgroup

Settings.Description: Define various sizing options of sub-group size for NGG primitive shader.
Settings.Name: NggSubgroupSizing

Settings.Description: Preferred number of GS primitives to pack into a primitive shader sub-group Use this instead of PAL setting, NggPrimsPerSubgroup.
Settings.Name: NggPrimsPerSubgroup

Settings.Description: Preferred number of vertices consumed by a primitive shader sub-group Use this instead of PAL setting, NggVertsPerSubgroup.
Settings.Name: NggVertsPerSubgroup

Settings.Description: Enable culling of primitives that don't meet facing criteria. Use this instead of PAL setting, EnableBackfaceCullMask.
Settings.Name: NggEnableBackfaceCulling

Settings.Description: Enable discarding of primitives outside of view frustum. Use this instead of PAL setting, EnableAccurateFrustumCullMask.
Settings.Name: NggEnableFrustumCulling

Settings.Description: Enable simpler frustum culler that is less accurate.
Settings.Name: NggEnableBoxFilterCulling

Settings.Description: Enable frustum culling based on a sphere.
Settings.Name: NggEnableSphereCulling

Settings.Description: Enable trivial sub-sample primitive culling. Use this instead of PAL setting, EnableSmallPrimFilterMask.
Settings.Name: NggEnableSmallPrimFilter

Settings.Description: Enable culling when cull distance exports are present.
Settings.Name: NggEnableCullDistanceCulling

Settings.Description: Enable culling only if there is more than one render target.
Settings.Name: RequireMrtForNggCulling

Settings.Description: Force HW to guarantee forward progress per wave on GFX10 0x00000000 - Disable (default) 0x00000001 - Enable for vertex shaders 0x00000002 - Enable for tessellation control shaders 0x00000004 - Enable for tessellation evaluation shaders 0x00000008 - Enable for geometry shaders 0x00000010 - Enable for fragment shaders 0x00000020 - Enable for compute shaders
Settings.Name: EnableForwardProgress

Settings.Description: Allocate waves for execution with 4 SIMDs (WGP) instead of letting the compiler choose  WGP vs CU (2 SIMDs) on GFX10
Settings.Name: EnableWgpMode

Settings.Description: Choose a region size, if any, to force the end of the wavefront before the next available quad that falls outside the region. 0x0 - None (default)     - No wave break by region 0x1 - 8x8      - Break outside a 8x8 pixel region 0x2 - 16x16    - Break outside a 16x16 pixel region 0x3 - 32x32    - Break outside a 32x32 pixel region 0xF
Settings.Name: WaveBreakSize

Settings.Description: This option is valid when EnableDropPipelineBinaryInst is set to true. It should be specified with the hex value of first dword of instruction. For example: DropPipelineBinaryInstToken,0xE1084000
Settings.Name: DropPipelineBinaryInstToken

Settings.Description: This option is valid when EnableDropPipelineBinaryInst is set to true. It should be specified with the size in dword of instruction to be dropped.
Settings.Name: DropPipelineBinaryInstSize

Settings.Description: [BIL ONLY] Generate optimized IL codes for performance purpose. This may break some precision rules and may not produce 100% conforming IL codes. Therefore, the option should only be enabled via application profile.
Settings.Name: EnableSpvPerfOptimal

Settings.Description: [BIL ONLY] Enable SPIR-V binary validation.
Settings.Name: EnableSpvValidation

Settings.Description: GFX10 plus-specific tessellation factor optimization.
Settings.Name: OptimizeTessFactor

Settings.Description: [BIL ONLY] Zero initialize AMD IL registers.
Settings.Name: ZeroInitILRegs

Settings.Description: [BIL ONLY] Skip unsupported SPIR-V instructions.
Settings.Name: SkipUnsupportedOpCode

Settings.Description: A bitmask of flags that control relaxed precision features.

Values.Name: RelaxedPrecisionEnabled
Values.Description: Enable generic relaxed precision handling (required for other settings).

Values.Name: RelaxedPrecisionRelaxDefaultUniform
Values.Description: Force default uniform to 16-bit type if decorated with relaxed precision.

Values.Name: RelaxedPrecisionKeepAllOutput
Values.Description: Align all fragment shader input to pre-stage output precision when in-out precision does not match.

Values.Name: RelaxedPrecisionIgnoreSrcOperand
Values.Description: Ignore the relaxed precision limitation of source operands, this will relax the rule of determining whether the conversion can be performed.

Settings.Name: RelaxedPrecisionFlags

Settings.Description: [LLPC ONLY] LLPC general options. Max length of the option is 256. for example: Disable Loop unroll: -pragma-unroll-threshold=1 Enable si-scheduler: -enable-si-scheduler Please see amdllpc -help or -help-hidden for detail
Settings.Name: LlpcOptions

Values.Name: ShaderCacheEnableRuntimeOnly
Values.Description: Shader Cache is enabled for runtime use only.

Values.Name: ShaderCacheEnableOnDisk
Values.Description: Shader Cache is enabled with on-disk file backing.

Values.Name: ShaderCacheForceInternalCacheOnDisk
Values.Description: Shader Cache is forced on with on-disk file backing even for applications that specify pipeline caches.

Settings.Description: Controls whether the Device shader cache should be used to try to avoid redundant shader compiles.
Settings.Name: ShaderCacheMode

Settings.Description: This option is valid when EnableDropPipelineBinaryInst is set to true. It should be specified with the hex value to mask DropPipelineBinaryInstToken. For example: DropPipelineBinaryInstMask,0xFFFF0000
Settings.Name: DropPipelineBinaryInstMask
AllowVkPipelineCachingToDisk
Settings.Description: Controls whether the pipeline compiler enables internal pipeline caching. This also allows the Vulkan application to get a Vulkan Pipeline Cache object based on internal caches, without creating an application-managed Vulkan Pipeline Cache. (Default: TRUE) Related environment variables AMD_ARCHIVE_DISK_CACHE_PATH: Path to where archive file is to be stored (optional) AMD_ARCHIVE_APP_PREFIX     : Fixed prefix string for generated archive file name (optional)

Settings.Name: EnableInternalPipelineCachingToDisk
Settings.Description: Controls whether the pipeline compiler enables Pal's archive-file based caching for internal pipelines. (Default: TRUE) Related environment variables AMD_ARCHIVE_DISK_CACHE_PATH: Path to where archive file is to be stored (optional) AMD_ARCHIVE_APP_PREFIX     : Fixed prefix string for generated archive file name (optional)

Settings.Name: AllowExternalPipelineCacheObject
Settings.Description: Controls whether a pipeline cache object is allowed to be created via vkCreatePipelineCache in addition to the cache residing within the pipeline compiler. (Default: TRUE)

Settings.Name: UsePipelineCacheInitialData
Settings.Description: Controls whether to use existing, compiled runtime shader pipeline caches. (Default: TRUE)

Settings.Name: PipelineCachingEnvironmentVariable
Settings.Description: Environment variable to check for to enable Pal Pipeline Caching. This allows launcher applications to dynamically control whether we cache pipleline ELFs or not. When converted to an integer any 0 value will be treated as False, and any non-zero value will be treated as true. Functionally equivalent to setting UsePalPipelineCaching = True/False

Settings.Name: UsePipelineCachingDefaultLocation
Settings.Description: Allow use of default pipeline cache location.

Settings.Name: PipelineCachingDefaultLocation
Settings.Description: Default sub folder to write PAL pipeline cache if not specified by environment variable AMD_VK_PIPELINE_CACHE_PATH.

Settings.Name: PipelineCacheDefaultLocationLimitation
Settings.Description: The size of PipelineCachingDefaultLocation is limited to (default 10GB).

Settings.Name: AllowCleanUpCacheDirectory
Settings.Description: Controls whether the cache directory is cleaned up by xgl driver

Settings.Name: ThresholdOfCleanUpCache
Settings.Description: Driver will delete files from oldest to (oldest + Threshold). The threshold unit is seconds. Default is 86400

Settings.Name: FilterPipelineDumpByType
Settings.Description: Filter which types of pipeline dump are disabled. These options can be used to dump pipelines of a specific type. By default, all the pipelines are logged.

Values.Name: PipelineDumpFilterNone
Values.Description: Do not disable any pipeline type

Values.Name: PipelineDumpFilterCs
Values.Description: Disable pipeline dump for Cs pipelines

Values.Name: PipelineDumpFilterNgg
Values.Description: Disable pipeline dump for NGG pipelines

Values.Name: PipelineDumpFilterGs
Values.Description: Disable pipeline dump for Gs pipelines

Values.Name: PipelineDumpFilterTess
Values.Description: Disable pipeline dump for Tess pipelines

Values.Name: PipelineDumpFilterVsPs
Values.Description: Disable pipeline dump for VsPs pipelines

Settings.Name: FilterPipelineDumpByHash
Settings.Description: If non-zero, only dump the pipeline with this compiler hash.

Directory where ShaderDbg layer read its config file. The file is named "shaderDbg.cfg" with several lines. Each line represents a pipeline and has such format "pipelineHash,stageMask" (1 - compute shader, 2 - vertex shader, 4 - tessellation control shader, 8 - tessellation evaluation shader, 16 - geometry shader, 32 - fragment shader).
Settings.Name: ShaderDbgCfgDirectory

Settings.Description: If true, duplicate pipelines will be dumped to a file with a numeric suffix attached to the filename to distinguish each copy of the pipeline.
Settings.Name: DumpDuplicatePipelines

Settings.Description: Mask for enabling SPIR-V pass for internal ray tracing pipelines. The bit is corresponding to the enum defined in gpurt header.
Settings.Name: RtInternalPipelineSpvPassMask
DbgBarrierPostCmdEnable
Settings.Description: Triggers a CmdBarrier call after any command in the given mask.  The barrier behavior is controlled by the other DbgBarrierPost* settings in this category.  Requires VK_ENABLE_DEBUG_BARRIERS=1 to take effect. 0x8FFFFFFF: All commands (heavyweight option)

Values.Name: DbgBarrierCopyBuffer
Values.Description: Any transfer copy involving a buffer

Values.Name: DbgBarrierCopyImage
Values.Description: Any transfer copy involving an image

Values.Name: DbgBarrierCopyQueryPool
Values.Description: Any transfer copy involving a query pool

Values.Name: DbgBarrierClearColor
Values.Description: Any color clear operation (including render pass clears)

Values.Name: DbgBarrierClearDepth
Values.Description: Any depth-stencil clear operation (including render pass clears)

Values.Name: DbgBarrierResolve
Values.Description: Any resolve operation (including render pass resolves)

Values.Name: DbgBarrierSetDynamicPipelineState
Values.Description: Any vkCmdSet* which programs dynamic pipeline state

Values.Name: DbgBarrierOther
Values.Description: Any other command not listed above

Settings.Description: For post-cmd barriers, this flag describes the PAL HwPipePoint pipeline stage where the barrier will wait.
Settings.Name: DbgBarrierPostWaitPipePoint

Settings.Description: For post-cmd barriers, this flag describes the PAL HwPipePoint pipeline stage where the barrier is signaled.
Settings.Name: DbgBarrierPostSignalPipePoint

Settings.Description: For post-cmd barriers, this flag describes the PAL CacheCoherencyUsageFlags source mask.
Settings.Name: DbgBarrierPostCacheSrcMask

Settings.Description: For post-cmd barriers, this flag describes the PAL CacheCoherencyUsageFlags destination mask.
Settings.Name: DbgBarrierPostCacheDstMask

Settings.Description: Triggers a CmdBarrier call before any command in the given mask.  The barrier behavior is controlled by the other DbgBarrierPre* settings in this category.  Requires VK_ENABLE_DEBUG_BARRIERS=1 to take effect. For further documentation, consult the corresponding DbgBarrierPostCmdEnable command.
Settings.Name: DbgBarrierPreCmdEnable

Settings.Description: For pre-cmd barriers, this flag describes the PAL HwPipePoint pipeline stage where the barrier will wait. For further documentation, consult DbgBarrierPostWaitPipePoint.
Settings.Name: DbgBarrierPreWaitPipePoint

Settings.Description: For pre-cmd barriers, this flag describes the PAL HwPipePoint pipeline stage where the barrier is signaled. For further documentation, consult DbgBarrierPostSignalPipePoint.
Settings.Name: DbgBarrierPreSignalPipePoint

Settings.Description: For pre-cmd barriers, this flag describes the PAL CacheCoherencyUsageFlags source mask. For further documentation, consult DbgBarrierPostCacheSrcMask.
Settings.Name: DbgBarrierPreCacheSrcMask

Settings.Description: For pre-cmd barriers, this flag describes the PAL CacheCoherencyUsageFlags destination mask. For further documentation, consult DbgBarrierPostCacheDstMask.
Settings.Name: DbgBarrierPreCacheDstMask

Settings.Description: Instanced vertex buffer table ring size.
Settings.Name: VertexBufferTableInstanceRingSize

Values.Name: CombinedAccessMasks
Values.Description: Ignore Vulkan separate access mask rule

Values.Name: SkipDstCacheInv
Values.Description: Do not invalidate dest caches if src cache was not updated

Values.Name: PreferFlushOverInv
Values.Description: By default we invalidate input caches to accomodate the Vulkan separate access mask rule. When this is set we'll instead flush all output caches instead to achieve the same goal. Mutually exclusive with SkipDstCacheInv. May or may not be beneficial for certain applications.

Values.Name: Gfx6KeepShaderCoher
Values.Description: Keep shader domain always coherent on GFX6-GFX8 thus avoiding L2 cache flushes/invalidations in shader-to-shader barrier cases at the expense of always flushing/invalidating L1 caches. This does NOT violate the Vulkan separate access mask rule. This behavior is likely preferred on GFX6-GFX8.

Values.Name: Gfx6AvoidCpuMemoryCoher
Values.Description: Avoid CPU and memory domain coherency on GFX6-GFX8 unless corresponding flags are explicitly requested to lower the number of L2 cache flushes/invalidations. This does NOT violate the Vulkan separate access mask rule. This behavior may or may not be beneficial on GFX6-GFX8.

Values.Name: Gfx9KeepShaderCoher
Values.Description: Keep shader domain always coherent on GFX9+ thus avoiding L2 cache flushes/invalidations in shader-to-shader barrier cases at the expense of always flushing/invalidating L1 caches. This does NOT violate the Vulkan separate access mask rule. This behavior may not be beneficial on GFX9+.

Values.Name: Gfx9AvoidCpuMemoryCoher
Values.Description: Avoid CPU and memory domain coherency on GFX9+ unless corresponding flags are explicitly requested to lower the number of L2 cache flushes/invalidations. This does NOT violate the Vulkan separate access mask rule. This behavior is preferred on GFX9+ as all other accesses go through the L2.

Settings.Description: Force command buffer based barrier queue usage. Default Value: SkipDstCacheInv | Gfx6AvoidCpuMemoryCoher | Gfx9AvoidCpuMemoryCoher
Settings.Name: ResourceBarrierOptions
BarrierFilterOptions
Settings.Description: Flags to describe strategies of avoiding barrier operations. These are illegal optimizations according to the Vulkan spec but may be acceptable for some applications

Values.Name: SkipStrayExecutionDependencies
Values.Description: The driver is unable to know if a source pipeline stage mask is for a standalone execution dependency or the access scope of a skippable memory dependency. Checking for the source and destination pipeline stage masks doesn't always provide the developer's intent either.

Values.Name: SkipImageLayoutUndefined
Values.Description: Ignore image memory barrier transitions out of undefined in the hope that there will be a full coverage clear to the image next making this likely mask RAM initialization redundant. Transitions to transfer dst optimal are not skipped to avoid issues with slow clears and copies, which require initialized metadata.

Values.Name: SkipDuplicateResourceBarriers
Values.Description: Ignores resource barriers that have the same source and destination parameters in case a full cross-bar sync isn't required.

Values.Name: ForceImageSharingModeExclusive
Values.Description: Exclusive queue family access reduces some memory dependency operations and removes the restriction that the image layout must be supported for multiple queue families. VK_SHARING_MODE_CONCURRENT is only acceptable to ignore when the application unnecessarily specified extra queue families without accessing the resource using them. Setting this option illegally might avoid all the pitfalls in a given application, but they are too numerous to list (e.g. requiring a decompress on an async compute queue).

Values.Name: SkipWithAppProfile
Values.Description: Filter all requested pipeline barriers in an application profile specified by the setting BarrierFilterProfileFile.

Values.Name: SkipWithAppProfileRegen
Values.Description: Same as SkipWithAppProfile but the pipeline hashes are not considered in order to regenerate strong barrier hashes after any application updates to its shaders.

Values.Name: SkipWithIntDevOverlay
Values.Description: Manually remove barriers using keyboard shortcuts to visualize their effects. Use in conjunction with the developer overlay. See the setting VulkanOverlayEnable OverlayBarrierFiltering option for details. SkipWithAppProfile and SkipWithAppProfileRegen may be used simultaneously to refine or regenerate an existing profile.

Settings.Description: Path to a file that contains application-specific barrier filter profiles. The contents are read on startup and used if BarrierFilterOptions SkipWithAppProfile, SkipWithAppProfileRegen, or SkipWithIntDevOverlay are set. On exit, an updated profile is written to this same file. This setting only triggers on debug builds.
Settings.Name: BarrierFilterProfileFile

Settings.Description: The number of pipeline cache count we treat as excessive and thus a smaller internal implementation is used for pipeline cache.
Settings.Name: ExcessivePipelineCacheCountThreshold

Settings.Description: If not UINT_MAX, this PAL enumerated device index will always be returned as the first enumerated physical device.
Settings.Name: EnumPreferredDeviceIndex

Settings.Description: Force VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::robustBufferAccess.
Settings.Name: RobustBufferAccess

Settings.Description: Allows instance-level functions to be queried using vkGetDeviceProcAddr.
Settings.Name: LenientInstanceFuncQuery

Settings.Description: Determines where the vkAppProfile.txt file will be written to. This file contains  the app profile enumeration index.
Settings.Name: AppProfileDumpDir
OptEnablePrt
Settings.Description: Enable PRT feature in general. The detailed feature set is decided according to caps reported by Pal.

Settings.Name: AsyncComputeQueueMaxWavesPerCu
Settings.Description: Limit the number of waves in flight per compute unit. This can be used to throttle async compute workloads so that they don't starve the universal queue.

Settings.Name: AsyncComputeQueueLimit
Settings.Description: Limit the number of async compute queues that are reported.

Settings.Name: LimitSampleCounts
Settings.Description: Mask the sample counts returned in vkPhysicalDeviceLimits and vkGetPhysicalDeviceImageProperties (OriginalValue & ThisValue). This setting does not actually affect support for sample counts, only what is returned to the application. This value should be a combination of VKSampleCountFlags

Settings.Name: AlwaysReportHdrFormats
Settings.Description: Always report HDR formats(If monitor supports them) to the application.

Settings.Name: EnableEmitSqttFunctionCrc
Settings.Description: Emit 64-bit AMDIL CRC to SQTT.

Settings.Name: DisableImageResourceTypeCheck
Settings.Description: Defines the default behavior for image resource type checking within the shader. The driver may override this behavior on a per-app and per-shader basis.

Settings.Name: UseOldDeviceUUIDCalculation
Settings.Description: Old calculation only use pci bdf (busNumber, deviceNumber, functionNumber) to compose the UUID.
Custom device allocation count limitation, when larger than 0.
Settings.Name: MemoryCustomDeviceAllocationCountLimit

Settings.Description: All VkMemory memory objects will have the following the GPU VA base address alignment.
Settings.Name: MemoryBaseAddrAlignment

Settings.Description: On 32-bit Windows builds, the following GPU VA base alignment is used for host-visible memory types instead of MemoryBaseVaAlign.
Settings.Name: MemoryBaseAddrAlignmentCpuVisibleWin32
MemoryRemoteBackupHeapMinHeapSize
Settings.Description: If the size of a device-local heap is smaller than this value, the remote (GART USWC) heap is used as a secondary heap for VkMemory objects created using the default GPU-local memory type for that device-local heap. The remote back-up heap is added regardless when overallocation is allowed via the VK_AMD_memory_overallocation extension.

Default priority of all VkMemory objects as two hex digits.  The first (most-significant) digit defines the priority level, and the second digit defines the priority offset.  Valid priority level values (Pal::GpuMemPriority) are:  0: Unused 1: VeryLow 2: Low 3: Normal 4: High 5: VeryHigh. Valid priority offset values (Pal::GpuMemPriorityOffset) are: 0: Offset0 (same as base level) 1: Offset1 2: Offset2 3: Offset3 4: Offset4 5: Offset5 6: Offset6 7: Offset7
Settings.Name: MemoryPriorityDefault

Settings.Description: Priority of all VkMemory objects containing at least one image. See MemoryPriorityDefault for valid values.
Settings.Name: MemoryPriorityImageAny

Settings.Description: Priority of all VkMemory objects containing at least one image shader-readable image. See MemoryPriorityDefault for valid values.
Settings.Name: MemoryPriorityImageShaderRead

Settings.Description: Priority of all VkMemory objects containing at least one shader-writable (storage) image. See MemoryPriorityDefault for valid values.
Settings.Name: MemoryPriorityImageShaderWrite

Settings.Description: Priority of all VkMemory objects containing at least one image that can be a color target. See MemoryPriorityDefault for valid values.
Settings.Name: MemoryPriorityImageColorTarget

Settings.Description: Priority of all VkMemory objects containing at least one image that can be a depth-stencil. See MemoryPriorityDefault for valid values.
Settings.Name: MemoryPriorityImageDepthStencil

Settings.Description: On wddm1 and linux, there's no os functionality to report memory budget. We fudge heap budget size as HeapBudgetRatioOfHeapSizeLocal% of heap size for GpuHeapLocal. Valid value is [0, 100].
Settings.Name: HeapBudgetRatioOfHeapSizeLocal

Settings.Description: On wddm1 and linux, there's no os functionality to report memory budget. We fudge heap budget size as HeapBudgetRatioOfHeapSizeInvisible% of heap size for GpuHeapInvisible Valid value is [0, 100].
Settings.Name: HeapBudgetRatioOfHeapSizeInvisible

Settings.Description: On wddm1 and linux, there's no os functionality to report memory budget. We fudge heap budget size as HeapBudgetRatioOfHeapSizeNonlocal% of heap size for GpuHeapGartUswc and GpuHeapGartCacheable. Valid value is [0, 100].
Settings.Name: HeapBudgetRatioOfHeapSizeNonlocal

Settings.Description: Whether driver should perform sparse resource unmap at resource destroy time under wddm1.
Settings.Name: IsSparseUnmapBeforeDestroyEnabled

Settings.Description: Override reported minImageTransferGranularity field for graphics queue families.  This is encoded as a hex string of the form 0xb000zzyyxx, where 'xx', 'yy', and 'zz' are the reported transfer granularities in the X, Y and Z extents respectively, and 'b' is a control flag: if 'b' is non-zero, this override is applies; otherwise the standard transfer granularity is used.
Settings.Name: TransferGranularityUniversalOverride

Settings.Description: Override reported minImageTransferGranularity field for compute queue families.  For how this value is interpreted by the driver, see the description for TransferGranularityUniversalOverride.
Settings.Name: TransferGranularityComputeOverride

Settings.Description: Device-local memory that is explicitly allocated by the application can tracked on a per-device and per-heap basis. Once the size of a target heap is reached, VK_OUT_OF_DEVICE_MEMORY will be returned. Setting this parameter to TRUE will disable such tracking by DEFAULT. This parameter can be overridden by the VK_AMD_memory_overallocation_behavior device extension and specific app profiles (unless MemoryDeviceOverallocationNonOverridable is set to TRUE).
Settings.Name: MemoryDeviceOverallocationAllowed

Settings.Description: MemoryDeviceOverallocationAllowed can be overriden by the VK_AMD_memory_overallocation_behavior device extension and specific app profiles unless this parameter is set to TRUE.
Settings.Name: MemoryDeviceOverallocationNonOverridable

Settings.Description: Override reported minImageTransferGranularity field for DMA (i.e. SDMA) queue families. For how this value is interpreted by the driver, see the description for TransferGranularityUniversalOverride.
Settings.Name: TransferGranularityDmaOverride

Settings.Description: If this option is enabled, the following changes are introduced:  (1) Images with VK_IMAGE_TILING_OPTIMAL may not be bound to memory types with VK_MEMORY_PROPERTY_HOST_VISIBLE_BIT.  (2) For each memory type that was previously host visible and usable with optimal images, an another memory type is created that is not host visible and can be used with optimally tiled images.
Settings.Name: AddHostInvisibleMemoryTypesForOptimalImages

Settings.Description: If this option is enabled, the driver returns an extra image memory requirement. The amount of memory is determined by memoryPaddingFactorForImageMemoryRequirements.This can be used while capturing GFXR traces and can be helpful for DCC tuning
Settings.Name: AddMemoryPaddingToImageMemoryRequirements

Settings.Description: When AddMemoryPaddingToImageMemoryRequirements setting is enabled, this value determines how much extra memory is to be padded. By default, 10% extra is added.
Settings.Name: MemoryPaddingFactorForImageMemoryRequirements

Settings.Description: [GFX10+ only] MALL NOALLOC resource policy.

Values.Name: MallNoAllocCt
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy for color target resource

Values.Name: MallNoAllocDs
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy for depth stencil resource

Values.Name: MallNoAllocImageViewSrds
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy for image view shader resource descriptors

Values.Name: MallNoAllocBufferViewSrds
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy for buffer view shader resource descriptors

Values.Name: MallNoAllocBvh
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy for BVH (bounding volume hierarchy, used by ray-trace)

Settings.Name: MallNoAllocResourcePolicy

Settings.Description: [GFX10+ only] MALL NOALLOC color target (RT) resource policy.

Values.Name: MallNoAllocCtDefault
Values.Description: Default policy for color target resources

Values.Name: MallNoAllocCtAsSnsr
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy when color target resource is used as shader non-storage resource (SNSR <-> SRV)

Values.Name: MallNoAllocCtAsCt
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy when color target resource is used as color target

Settings.Name: MallNoAllocCtPolicy

Settings.Description: [GFX10+ only] MALL NOALLOC shader storage resource (SSR <-> UAV) policy.

Values.Name: MallNoAllocSsrDefault
Values.Description: Default policy for shader storage resources

Values.Name: MallNoAllocSsrAsSnsr
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy when shader storage resource is used as shader non-storage resource (SNSR <-> SRV)

Values.Name: MallNoAllocSsrAsSsr
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy when shader storage resource is used as shader storage resource

Settings.Name: MallNoAllocSsrPolicy

Settings.Description: [GFX10+ only] MALL NOALLOC depth stencil resource policy.

Values.Name: MallNoAllocDsDefault
Values.Description: Default policy for depth stencil resources

Values.Name: MallNoAllocDsAsSnsr
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy when depth stencil resource is used as shader non-storage resource (SNSR <-> SRV)

Values.Name: MallNoAllocDsAsDs
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy whendepth stencil resource is used as depth stencil resource

Settings.Name: MallNoAllocDsPolicy

Settings.Description: [GFX10+ only] MALL NOALLOC color target and shader storage resource (SSR <-> UAV) policy.

Values.Name: MallNoAllocCtSsrDefault
Values.Description: Default policy for color target and shader storage resources

Values.Name: MallNoAllocCtSsrAsSnsr
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy when color target and shader storage resource is used as shader non-storage resource (SNSR <-> SRV)

Values.Name: MallNoAllocCtSsrAsDs
Values.Description: NOALLOC policy when color target and shader storage resource is used as depth stencil resource

Settings.Name: MallNoAllocCtSsrPolicy

Values.Name: OverrideChoiceForGartUswc
Values.Description: Force another heap in place of GART USWC allocations

Values.Name: OverrideChoiceForGartCacheable
Values.Description: Force another heap in place of GART cacheable allocations

Settings.Description: Allocations for selected heaps get redirected to local visible.
Settings.Name: OverrideHeapChoiceToLocal

Settings.Description: If overrideHeapChoiceToLocal is set, GpuHeapLocal is replaces requested heap use until this budget is met. Valid value is [0, 100].
Settings.Name: OverrideHeapChoiceToLocalBudget

Settings.Description: Forces allocations for GART cacheable to be allocated as GART USWC
Settings.Name: OverrideHeapGartCacheableToUswc

Settings.Description: Forces a particular AppProfile value.  The profile selected is the value of ForceAppProfileValue.
Settings.Name: ForceAppProfileEnable

Settings.Description: Forces a particular AppProfile value.  This value is the integer value of the AppProfile enum. Ignored unless ForceAppProfileEnable is true.
Settings.Name: ForceAppProfileValue

Values.Name: EnablePreciseAniso
Values.Description: PrecisAniso will be enabled. Highest image quality.

Values.Name: DisablePreciseAnisoAfOnly
Values.Description: PrecisAniso will be disabled only for anisotropic samplers.

Values.Name: DisablePreciseAnisoAll
Values.Description: PrecisAniso will be disabled for all samplers. Lowest image quality.

Settings.Description: PreciseAnisoMode denotes whether preciseAniso will be enabled.
Settings.Name: PreciseAnisoMode

Settings.Description: Supply the threshold value for anisotropic filtering (DisablePreciseAniso needs to be true also)
Settings.Name: UseAnisoThreshold

Settings.Description: The threshold value for anisotropic filtering (DisablePreciseAniso & UseAnisoThreshold need to be true also) Default value (0.25) preserves the Pal behaviour
Settings.Name: AnisoThreshold

Settings.Description: Controls the value of the PERF_MIP field in Sampler SRDs (DisablePreciseAniso needs to be true also)
Settings.Name: SamplerPerfMip

Settings.Description: Use flip hint for swapchain. Linux Only. The X Server make the final decision whether to go async flip.
Settings.Name: UseFlipHint

Settings.Description: Force fullscreen exclusive presents when detected safe.  The following combination of flags control whether this feature is enabled for a particular OS + swapchain combination:
Settings.Name: BackgroundFullscreenPresent

Settings.Description: Fullscreen presents may fail due to unexpected errors, although these cases are rare. Failing a fullscreen present and reattempting to acquire exclusive access causes dropped frames and screen flickering.  This is a fail-safe setting that permanently disables the fullscreen present logic after the given number of consecutive unexpected failures.
Settings.Name: BackgroundFullscreenFailureDisableCount

Settings.Description: Reset the failure count only after this many consecutive successful fullscreen presents. A large value for this setting is used to guarantee that we are consistently presenting in fullscreen instead of rapidly ping-ponging between fullscreen and windowed presents.
Settings.Name: BackgroundFullscreenSuccessResetCount

Settings.Description: When forcing fullscreen presents, this flag will ignore unexpected errors on any failed present.
Settings.Name: BackgroundFullscreenIgnorePresentErrors

Values.Name: Balanced
Values.Description: Balance memory foorprint and rendering performance.

Values.Name: OptForSpace
Values.Description: Optimize tiling mode for saving memory footprint

Values.Name: OptForSpeed
Values.Description: Optimize tiling mode for rendering performance.

Settings.Description: Hints to PAL to select the appropriate tiling mode for an optimization target. 0: Balanced 1: OptForSpace 2: OptForSpeed
Settings.Name: ImageTilingOptMode

Settings.Description: Hints to pal to identify a preference for how this image is organized. 0: Default 1: Standard 2: XMajor 3: YMajor 4: Interleaved
Settings.Name: ImageTilingPreference

Settings.Description: Override the ImageTilingPreference setting value for 3D images used as color attachments or shader storage.
Settings.Name: ImageTilingPreference3dGpuWritable

Settings.Description: Enable FMASK based MSAA texture reads.
Settings.Name: EnableFmaskBasedMsaaRead

Settings.Description: When Fmask based MSAA read is enabled, this can instruct il converter to optimize any fetch from sampleIndex 0 to fetch from Color 0 instead. This also may eliminate any dummy fmask lookups from depth surfaces.
Settings.Name: EnableFmaskLookUpOptSampleIndexZero

Settings.Description: Enable high priority for descriptor memory.
Settings.Name: EnableHighPriorityDescriptorMemory

Settings.Description: Disable Htile based MSAA texture reads.
Settings.Name: DisableHtileBasedMsaaRead

Settings.Description: If we know that a MSAA stencil aspect isn't read as a shader resource, give PAL a hint that it's okay to choose a non-TCC format.
Settings.Name: DisableMsaaStencilShaderRead

Settings.Description: For MSAA color image created with usage of transfer dst, enable this optimization to avoid heavy expanding.
Settings.Name: EnableFullCopyDstOnly

Settings.Description: For image created with usage of transfer src, add shader_read in PAL usage if VkImageUsageFlagBits in this mask is set.
Settings.Name: TransferSrcUsageAsShaderReadMask

Settings.Description: For image created with usage of transfer dst, add shader_write in PAL usage if VkImageUsageFlagBits in this mask is set.
Settings.Name: TransferDstUsageAsShaderWriteMask

Settings.Description: Enable extension AMD_GPU_SHADER_HALF_FLOAT and AMD_GPU_SHADER_INT16 only on ASIC >= gfx9.
Settings.Name: OnlyEnableFP16ForGfx9Plus

Settings.Description: If set, an image with color target usage bit does not implicitly allow to be in resolve_src or resolve_dst layout.
Settings.Name: ColorTargetUsageDoesNotContainResolveLayout

Settings.Description: If set, a depth stencil image with transfer usage bit is implicitly allowed to be in resolve_src or resolve_dst layout.
Settings.Name: ForceResolveLayoutForDepthStencilTransferUsage
RenderStateCacheEnable
Settings.Description: This bitmask denotes which subset of pipeline render state is cached at the device-level. Caching render state enables more efficient redundancy checking when recording command buffers.  This redundancy checking is mainly limited to pipeline state that is either invisible to the API (e.g. certain PAL objects) or state that the application has marked in the pipeline as non-dynamic, meaning its values are programmed during pipeline bind.

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheMsaaState
Values.Description: PAL MSAA state objects (all graphics pipelines)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheColorBlendState
Values.Description: PAL color blend state objects (all graphics pipelines)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheDepthStencilState
Values.Description: PAL depth stencil state objects (all graphics pipelines)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheInputAssemblyState
Values.Description: PAL input assembly state params (all graphics pipelines)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheTriangleRasterState
Values.Description: Triangle raster state params (part of every graphics pipeline)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticPointLineRasterState
Values.Description: Point line raster state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticDepthBias
Values.Description: Depth bias state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticBlendConst
Values.Description: Blend const state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticDepthBounds
Values.Description: Depth bounds state (only when marked static)

Values.Name: OptRenderStateCacheStaticScissorRect
Values.Description: Scissor rect state (only when marked static)

Settings.Description: If set, the MUTABLE flag on image is ignored.
Settings.Name: IgnoreMutableFlag

Values.Name: EnableOptimizeForRenderPassContinue
Values.Description: OptimizeCmdbuf will be enabled only for render pass continue.

Settings.Description: OptimizeCmdbufMode denotes whether pm4 optimizations will be enabled.
Settings.Name: OptimizeCmdbufMode

Settings.Description: If set, shaders are prefetched to warm L2 shader cache.
Settings.Name: PrefetchShaders

Settings.Description: If not UINT_MAX, sets the minimum BPP of surfaces which may have DCC enabled.
Settings.Name: DccBitsPerPixelThreshold
ForceEnableDcc
Settings.Description: If not default, force enables DCC on the basis of resource and/or BPP. NOTE: To force enable shader storage DCC, at least one of 2D/3D and one of CA/non-CA need to be set

Values.Name: ForceDccDefault
Values.Description: Let PAL heuristics decide what's best. Don't force anything in xgl.

Values.Name: ForceDccFor2DShaderStorage
Values.Description: Force enable DCC for 2D shader storage resources.

Values.Name: ForceDccFor3DShaderStorage
Values.Description: Force enable DCC for 3D shader storage resources.

Values.Name: ForceDccForColorAttachments
Values.Description: Force enable DCC for color attachments which are also shader storage resources.

Values.Name: ForceDccForNonColorAttachmentShaderStorage
Values.Description: Force enable DCC for shader storage resources that are not color attachments.

Values.Name: ForceDccFor32BppShaderStorage
Values.Description: Force enable DCC for shader storage resources with BPP range from 32 to 64.

Values.Name: ForceDccFor64BppShaderStorage
Values.Description: Force enable DCC for shader storage resources with 64 BPP or deeper.

Values.Name: ForceDisableDcc
Values.Description: Force disable DCC for every resource irrespective of PAL heuristics.

Settings.Name: DisableSmallSurfColorCompressionSize
Settings.Description: Provides a hint to PAL that PAL should disable color compression on surfaces that are smaller than or equal to this setting (setting * setting) in size.

Settings.Name: UseAcqRelInterface
Settings.Description: The acquire/release-based barrier interface is enabled.

Settings.Name: SyncTokenEnabled
Settings.Description: Using sync token is enabled.

Settings.Name: EnableSPP
Settings.Description: Enable Shader Profiling for Power (SPP).  The gist of the initial version of this feature is that we will profile important  applications to determine which shaders are heavily memory bound, then use these profiles  to program the RLC to dynamically reduce engine clocks when running such shaders.This  should result in power savings with a limited perf impact.

Settings.Name: DisableDisplayDcc
Settings.Description: Disables Display Dcc on presentable surface.
Enable async compile for shader module and pipelines.
Settings.Name: EnableAsyncCompile

Settings.Description: Enable partial pipeline compile.
Settings.Name: EnablePartialPipelineCompile

Settings.Description: Specifies the maximum threshold in bytes for linear transfer commands to use CP DMA, which have less overhead than CS/Gfx copies, but also less throughput for large copies.
Settings.Name: CpDmaCmdCopyMemoryMaxBytes

Settings.Description: This value denotes whether using CmdClearBoundAttachments/CmdClearBoundDepthStencilTargets for subpass load op clears or not.
Settings.Name: SubpassLoadOpClearsBoundAttachments

Settings.Description: Force all compute shaders to have swizzled thread groups.
Settings.Name: ForceCsThreadGroupSwizzleMode

Settings.Description: Force all ray tracing shaders compiled in unified mode to have swizzled thread groups.
Settings.Name: ForceRtThreadGroupSwizzleMode

Settings.Description: Determines the string that's used to trigger a start-frame delimiter via vkQueueInsertDebugUtilsLabelEXT. This string is "AmdFrameBegin" by default.
Settings.Name: DevModeStartFrameDebugUtilsLabel

Settings.Description: Determines the string that's used to trigger an end-frame delimiter via vkQueueInsertDebugUtilsLabelEXT. This string is "AmdFrameEnd" by default
Settings.Name: DevModeEndFrameDebugUtilsLabel

Settings.Description: Determines the pipeline binary max size limit (in KB) used by the PipelineUriService when injecting pipeline binaries back into the driver. The limit is 256KB by default.
Settings.Name: DevModePipelineUriServicePostSizeLimit

Settings.Description: This controls whether elf files placed in DevModeElfReplacementDirectory will be read.
Settings.Name: DevModeElfReplacementDirectoryEnable

Settings.Description: Elf files placed within this directory will be cached and replace corresponding pipeline binaries as they are created. Elf files within this directory should follow this nomenclature: "[exe name]_[hash of pipeline being replaced].elf"
Settings.Name: DevModeElfReplacementDirectory

Settings.Description: This controls whether RGP traces will include shader code of created pipelines.
Settings.Name: DevModeShaderIsaDbEnable

Settings.Description: This controls whether queue operations are timed during RGP traces.
Settings.Name: DevModeQueueTimingEnable

Settings.Description: This controls if the legacy timed queue semaphores are to be used on Windows instead of the ETW client. This parameter does not affect Linux.
Settings.Name: DevModeSemaphoreQueueTimingEnable

Settings.Description: This controls what kind of SQTT instrumentation marker data is output from the driver. Note that this only fine-tunes instrumentation: the master toggle for SQTT is always whether developer mode is enabled.  General SQTT data (event, wave, instruction) is also generated independent of this setting if SQTT is enabled.

Values.Description: Enable command buffer start instrumentation marker
Enable command buffer end instrumentation marker
Enable general API (per entry point call) instrunmentation markers
Enable dispatch events with thread dimensions
Write bound shader hashes as user event markers

Settings.Name: DevModeSqttMarkerEnable

Settings.Description: If true, SQTT support is disabled and all RGP traces will automatically fail.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttForceDisable

Settings.Description: If true, a CPU device wait idle is executed prior to starting and ending a trace. PLEASE NOTE: This is currently not thread safe and may result in crashes. It is only included as a debugging option.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttWaitIdle

Settings.Description: If true, inserts a full pipeline flush into all hardware queues at the beginning of the last preparation frame in an RGP trace.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttFlushAllQueues

Values.Description: Auto-calculate the size based on GPU characteristics.
Current HW requires the size be aligned to 0x1000 bytes.

Settings.Description: Maximum amount of data in bytes to capture per trace. A trace will cover a span of commands based on the GpuProfilerGranularity setting. Defaults to 0, which means auto-calculate the size based on GPU characteristics. Current HW requires the size be aligned to 0x1000 bytes.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttGpuMemoryLimit

Settings.Description: Number of frames (present calls) to trace SQTT.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttFrameCount

Settings.Description: Any driver-generated user event markers will have this string as its prefix.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttInternalUserEventPrefix

Settings.Description: If TRUE, DevModeSqttTrace[Begin|End]TagValues are used to override trace parameter begin/end command buffer debug object tag values. This is mainly used for debugging.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttTraceBeginEndTagEnable

Settings.Description: Custom command buffer debug object tag value signifying virtual frame start.  Requires DevModeSqttTraceBeginEndTagEnable.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttTraceBeginTagValue

Settings.Description: Custom command buffer debug object tag value signifying virtual frame end. Requires DevModeSqttTraceBeginEndTagEnable.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttTraceEndTagValue

Settings.Description: If TRUE, instruction-level tracing will be enabled. DevModeSqttTargetApiPsoHash can beused to specify the scope traced (full frame or individual pipeline).
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttInstructionTraceEnable

Settings.Description: Target API PSO hash used to trigger instruction level tracing. Full-frame instructiontracing will be enabled if set to 0x0.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttTargetApiPsoHash

Settings.Description: If TRUE, the driver will block immediately after ending a trace to wait for results tocomplete rather than asynchronously checking for completion during frame boundaries.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttForceBlockOnTraceEnd

Settings.Description: If non-default, this value will override the trace parameter prepare frame count, which isthe number of lead frames prior to enabling SQTT that include only queue timing.
Settings.Name: DevModeSqttPrepareFrameCount

Settings.Description: Enable RGP trace dumping directly from the driver (in addition to sending it to RDP). This is useful in situations where the network connection is very lossy.
Settings.Name: DevModeEnableRgpTraceDump

Settings.Description: File where the RGP trace is dumped when DevModeEnableRgpTraceDump is set.
Settings.Name: DevModeRgpTraceDumpFile
RgpInstTraceBarrierEnabled
Settings.Description: Controls the barrier inserted during RGP tracing when instruction trace is active which stalls at the end of the command buffer to ensure that instruction trace is not disabled while the pipeline being traced is still in flight.  This barrier has a significant effect on frame timing.

Settings.Name: OverrideShaderParams
Settings.Description: Indicate that shader parameter override is enabled - mainly used for automation

Settings.Name: OverrideShaderHashUpper
Settings.Description: Upper 64-bits of the shader hash of shader for which parameters are to be overridden

Settings.Name: OverrideShaderHashLower
Settings.Description: Lower 64-bits of the shader hash of shader for which parameters are to be overridden

Settings.Name: OverrideShaderStage
Settings.Description: Shader stage for which parameters are to be overriden.
Override number of available VGPRs for the shader specified by overrideShaderCrcUpper/Lower
Settings.Name: OverrideNumVGPRsAvailable

Settings.Description: Override number of waves per CU for the shader specified by overrideShaderCrcUpper/Lower
Settings.Name: OverrideWavesPerCu

Settings.Description: Force PAL to spill user data registers to memory for the shader specified by overrideShaderCrcUpper/Lower
Settings.Name: OverrideUserDataSpillThreshold

Settings.Description: Set the max LDS spill size in DWORDs for the shader specified by overrideShaderCrcUpper/Lower
Settings.Name: OverrideMaxLdsSpillDwords

Settings.Description: Override default setting to disable loop unrolls
Settings.Name: OverrideDisableLoopUnrolls

Settings.Description: [LLPC ONLY] Use LLVM backend's SI Scheduler instead of the default scheduler
Settings.Name: OverrideUseSiScheduler

Settings.Description: [LLPC ONLY] Allow automatic workgroup reconfigure to take place on compute shaders
Settings.Name: OverrideReconfigWorkgroupLayout

Settings.Description: [LLPC ONLY] Disable the LLVM backend's LICM pass
Settings.Name: OverrideDisableLicm

Settings.Description: [LLPC ONLY] Enable LLPC load scalarizer optimization
Settings.Name: OverrideEnableLoadScalarizer

Settings.Description: Enable selective inlining behavior in the compiler.
Settings.Name: OverrideEnableSelectiveInline

Settings.Description: Enable Subvector to look for opportunities in Wave64 mode to generate subvector code switching to Wave32 mode over parts of the shader
Settings.Name: OverrideEnableSubvector

Settings.Description: Set the thread-group per CU limit for compute shaders.
Settings.Name: OverrideCsTgPerCu
OverrideUsePbbPerCrc
Settings.Description: Set option to disable PBB for shader specified by OverrideShaderCrcUpper and OverrideShaderCrcLower

Values.Name: PipelineBinningModeDefault
Values.Description: Follow the behavior of the PipelineBinningMode setting.

Settings.Description: Override allowReZ for the shader specified by OverrideShaderHashUpper/Lower.
Settings.Name: OverrideAllowReZ
OverrideWaveSize
Settings.Description: Override WaveSize for the shader specified by OverrideShaderHashUpper/Lower.

Values.Name: WaveSizeAuto
Values.Description: Let the driver pick the best wave size for this shader

Settings.Name: OverrideWgpMode
Settings.Description: Override WgpMode for the shader specified by OverrideShaderHashUpper/Lower

Values.Name: WgpModeAuto
Values.Description: Let the driver pick the best WgpMode for this shader

Values.Name: WgpModeCu
Values.Description: All 4 SIMDs in a workgroup processor are considered when waves are allocated for execution

Values.Name: WgpModeWgp
Values.Description: Only the 2 SIMDs in a CU are considered when waves are allocated for execution

Settings.Name: OverrideUseNgg
Settings.Description: Override use of NGG on a per shader basis. Default behavior to enable NGG use

Settings.Name: ResourceProfileIgnoresAppProfile
Settings.Description: If this is true, any production app profile-installed resource optimizations are ignored.

Settings.Name: OverrideResourceParams
Settings.Description: Indicate that resource parameter override is enabled - mainly used for automation

Settings.Name: OverrideResourceHashDimensions
Settings.Description: The width (upper 32-bits) and height (lower 32-bits) of the resource(s) onto which the parameters are to be applied. If 0, the dimensions will be matched up.

Settings.Name: OverrideResourceHashCrc
Settings.Description: The API hash of the resource(s) onto which the parameters are to be applied. If 0, the API hash will not be matched up.

Settings.Name: OverrideResourceDccOnOff
Settings.Description: Force metadata to be enabled or disabled for the resource.

Settings.Name: VulkanTexFilterQuality
Settings.Description: Controls texture filtering optimizations exposed by CCC.

Settings.Name: AppGpuID
Settings.Description: Specifies the GPU ID (composed of PCI info).

Settings.Name: DisableAMDVendorExtensions
Settings.Description: Disables AMD Vendor Extensions

Settings.Name: AlwaysAllocDynamicDescriptorData
Settings.Description: Always allocates dynamic descriptor data instead of based on VkDescriptorPoolCreateInfo.pPoolSizes
